entries.title: EU Encouraged to Require Covid Tests for Passengers From China
entries.description: Caution remains among some member states about demanding negative tests 48 hours before departure.

entries.title: U.K.'s Rishi Sunak Vows to Cut Inflation in First Big Policy Speech
entries.description: With a national election expected in 2024, economists warn that Britain’s recession could be worse than that of other Western countries.

entries.title: Winter Heat Wave in Europe Sets Records, Forces Ski Resorts to Close Slopes
entries.description: An unseasonable warm front opened the year, raising temperatures about 15 degrees higher than normal.

entries.title: Why Xi Jinping Reversed His Zero-Covid Policy in China
entries.description: A wave of protests coupled with urgent pleas from many corners of the government finally prodded the leader to scrap the strict lockdown system he had touted throughout the pandemic. China now faces a flood of infections.

entries.title: Pope Francis May Have a Freer Hand After Death of Benedict
entries.description: The death of Pope Benedict XVI ended an extraordinary arrangement that helped define the current pontificate. Pope Francis had already taken a markedly different tack than his predecessor but he may feel even more able to do so now.

entries.title: Ukraine Sees Signs of Russia Shifting Firepower From Bakhmut
entries.description: Russian troops have tempered their assault on the city, Ukrainian commanders say, as stiff resistance forces Russian units to shift some of their firepower to surrounding areas.

entries.title: New Finance Minister Aims to Entrench Israeli Rule in West Bank
entries.description: The leader of the far-right Religious Zionism party said he plans to spend billions of dollars building infrastructure and investing in Jewish settlements in the territory.

entries.title: French Unions Vow to Fight Increase in Retirement Age
entries.description: France’s unions have pledged to dig in for a prolonged fight against French President Emmanuel Macron’s plan to overhaul the country’s pension system, a new threat to his pro-business agenda.

entries.title: Russia Blames Troops' Cellphone Use for Deadly Ukrainian Strike
entries.description: Russia blamed the use of banned mobile phones for a deadly strike by Ukrainian forces on a facility that housed newly mobilized Russian soldiers, shifting responsibility for the incident to the victims and raising the death toll to 89.
